title: Judo
summary: Judo (柔道, jūdō, Japanese pronunciation: [dʑɯꜜːdoː], lit. "gentle way") is a modern Japanese martial art, a system of unarmed combat, and now primarily a sport.[3] Judo is not only a training of body and mind, but also a way of human formation.[4][5] Judo was created in 1882 by Jigoro Kano (嘉納治五郎、1860–1938).[4][3]  He studied old jujutsu,[4] which is martial arts of Samurai, but he, as a pedagogue, decided to eliminate "the most dangerous techniques" [3]  and created new "Kano Jiu-Jitsu", which is now widely known as Judo. The ultimate goal of all judo practitioners is "Seiryoku-Zenyo (精力善用) and Jita-Kyoei (自他共栄)".[4]
